item.title: Zelenskyy ousts top gen accused of causing excessive troop casualties
Conservatives seize stronghold from Trudeau’s party in by-poll
Israeli SC orders army to draft ultra-Orthodox men, rattling Bibi govt
PM Sharif says anti-terror campaign to be intensified, no new military offensive
item.dc:creator: Omer Farooq Khan

item.title: Anti-tax protesters storm Kenya's parliament, drawing police fire as president vows to quash unrest
Assange to plead guilty to be free, ending standoff with US
Indian-origin doctor who drove Tesla off cliff won't face trial
item.description: ​Dharmesh Patel intentionally drove his Tesla off the cliff with his wife and two children sitting inside because he felt like the world was caving in because of Russia’s war in Ukraine, the fentanyl crisis, child sex trafficking, and Jeffery Epstein, according to prosecutors. His wife told investigators that he sent her news articles about those topics, and he struggled to sleep at night.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Security breach: Four people arrested for allegedly trespassing on grounds of British PM Rishi Sunak's home
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Airline double-books flight, irate passenger says 'I hope I become famous' in viral video
item.description: ​A passenger on an Avianca flight from Los Angeles to Bogota was asked to leave the plane that he was double-booked on, New York Post reported citing Colombian media reports. The report claimed that flight attendants had informed him that the flight was oversold but he allegedly bought his ticket three months ahead. "I am a lawyer, you should respect me," the man said during a fiery exchange on the flight.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: 2 Montana inmates charged with attempted murder after attacking jail guards
item.description: Two inmates attacked officers at Yellowstone County jail with improvised weapons, leading to attempted murder charges. The assault was recorded on security cameras, and the injured officer is expected to recover. The inmates face potential life sentences for the attack.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Tommy Robinson arrested in Canada on suspicion of immigration offences: 'Internationally embarrassing'
item.description: ​Far-right British activist Tommy Robinson has been arrested in Canada Tuesday on suspicion of immigration offences. The arrest came soon after he gave a speech in Calgary. He was then released but had his passport seized. On X, Tommy called it an 'internationally embarrassing situation" as he provided the latest update on his arrest. "I'm waiting for them to take my passport , someone somewhere is trying to work out what the hell to do with this internationally embarrassing situation they have created," he posted on X.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Hillary Clinton on what she's expecting from Trump vs Biden: 'Not best actor'
item.description: ​Former Secretary of State Hillary Clinton, who debated both Donald Trump and Joe Biden, elaborated on her expectations from the firs Biden-Trump face-off on CNN scheduled on June 27. In a New York Post article, she wrote that she loves theater about politics but not the other way round. "Too often we approach pivotal moments like this week's debate between President Biden and Donald Trump like drama critics. We're picking a president, not "best actor"," she wrote.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Art in the loo: Australian museum hangs Picasso collection in women’s toilet after court ruling
item.description: The Ladies Lounge, created by American artist Kirsha Kaechele, is currently under appeal after the Tasmanian Civil and Administrative Tribunal (Tascat) found the museum to be in violation of the state's anti-discriminatory law in April. The tribunal ordered Mona to grant access to the exhibition to "persons who do not identify as ladies."
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Why scientists are intrigued by air in Nasa’s Mars sample tubes
item.dc:creator: TOI Science Desk

item.title: Won't even trust a PB&J sandwich: Boeing under fire amid Starliner woes
item.description: As Indian-American astronaut Sunita Williams and her colleague astronaut Butch Wilmore are stuck at the International Space Station owing to multiple technical issues in Starliner, embattled Boeing has again come under fire as its two 737 Max crashes have not rightfully slipped into oblivion. After causing deaths of 5779 on Earth, Boeing sent the two astronauts to Space despite knowing the flaws of Starliner.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Can milk be considered racist? Researchers are trying to find out
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: This is the best town to visit right now in US
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Watch: In Biden camp's new ad, 'Trump is only out for himself'
item.description: ​Joe Biden's campaign released a new ad Tuesday hitting out at Donald Trump for thinking only for himself while Joe Biden is a champion of the middle class. In the 30-second ad, which will air in the battleground states of Georgia and Pennsylvania, a narrator says, "Donald Trump loves to attack Joe Biden because he's focused on revenge and he has no plan to help the middle class. He'd just give more tax cuts to the wealthy."
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Prince Harry and Meghan Markle can't go this country during world tour
item.description: Harry and Meghan's Nigeria trip rattled King Charles as he saw it "as an attempt to undermine the monarchy in the Commonwealth". The royal family was concerned that the couple had gone rogue. "For Charles and William, it’s as if Meghan and Harry are saying, ‘We don’t need your permission to be working royals — we will do it on our own terms whenever and wherever we like,’" Royal expert Tom Quinn earlier said.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Melania Trump won't move back to White House if Trump wins because...
item.description: ​Trump's youngest son Barron Trump could be going to college at New York University explaining why his mother would love to spend her time in NY, and at Florida where they have their resort in Palm Beach. If Melania chooses to be a part-time First Lady, this will be a first. ​“Melania does what Melania wants,” said Mary Jordan, a Washington Post associate editor and the author of the book “The Art of Her Deal: The Untold Story of Melania Trump.”
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk
